abstract: The agency’s use of internal trials has raised questions about fairness because defendants may not have all the same rights they have in federal court.
snippet: The agency’s use of internal trials has raised questions about fairness because defendants may not have all the same rights they have in federal court.
lead_paragraph: As the top cop on Wall Street, the Securities and Exchange Commission usually enjoys broad support for its work fighting fraud in the nation’s financial markets. But a recent agency stance has generated such criticism that even some of the S.E.C.’s high-powered alumni are calling for a do-over.

headline.main: Crying Foul on Plans to Expand the S.E.C.’s In-House Court System
headline.print_headline: Crying Foul on In-House S.E.C. Courts
